speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) It’s… her home. Here, in this canvas. We used to play here a lot… with the others… But now the one here… She is not her. She will never be. And she knows that.

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) Everything is always about her… About her painting, her sculpting… Everything has to be perfect, but perfect I have never been. And perfect she is not, the one who is here now. Maybe… Maybe it’s better to forget about all of this… But she is trapped here, behind this door, in her atelier. Forever painting…

speaker: Lune
line: How do we open the door behind you?

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) The colours… Bring back the colour to her paintings. She mocked Aline’s creation, trapped by her own paintings. Her Navrons stole her colours. If you could find them and unpaint them, then maybe… Maybe she will be free.

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) You have conquered your foe, once again… Should I take you back to the plaza?

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) You… You did it… You can go in her atelier now… But… She might not recognize you, for her soul is long gone. Don’t let her unpaint you. That’s not.. What she would have wanted…

speaker: Verso
line: Clea… You’re alive? What happened to her?

speaker: Maelle
line: I bet Clea hated Maman’s portrait of her. So she painted over her.

speaker: Verso
line: Can you heal her? Can you change her back?

speaker: Maelle
line: I can’t repaint her, Clea’s the only one skilled enough to paint over someone else’s creation.

speaker: Lune
line: This is going to be tough.

speaker: Verso
line: Clea. No, no, no, no, wait…

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s trying to find a way out.

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) Have you… Laid her to rest?

speaker: Young boy
line: (gibberish) Thank you… She… That’s what she wanted. I wish… I wish she would have listened to me. Then she wouldn’t have to make this painting suffer. Painting or not, she had feelings, and a soul. That’s what I think, at least, but I know she thinks differently. For me, everything in this canvas is as much alive as what is outside. Esquie, the Gestrals, the Grandis, even Aline’s paintings. I welcome them all. Painting should be a celebration. Just like music… Thank you for taking care of her. It may not be much, but would you accept a gift from me? A garment we had designed together. I can make only one. Who should have it? Wonderful. Here, have this. Thank you. For everything. Take care of yourself, and of the paintings around you.

speaker: Sciel
line: When we first met, what did you mean by “my terrible swimmer friend?”

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh, you mean the second time we met.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh yeah, me too. It’s fun.

speaker: Sciel
line: What do you mean by “second time?”

speaker: Esquie
line: First means number one. Second means number two.

speaker: Sciel
line: Um. Yes, I understand that. So was I- was I swimming the first time we met?

speaker: Esquie
line: Yes, you were. Before you stopped swimming in the middle of the ocean. That’s dangerous!

speaker: Sciel
line: It was you. You saved me. Back then. Wait, but how?

speaker: Esquie
line: I heard you, so I came.

speaker: Esquie
line: Tears again. You sure do like to cry.

speaker: Esquie
line: Hehehe. You were looking for someone then. Did you find them?

speaker: Esquie
line: Mmm. Yeah. I get sad too, when I lose my stones. But I always find them again. You will find them again too.

speaker: Lune
line: What will you do, when this is all over? I’m having trouble imagining you living a “normal” life in Lumière.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, I’m not sure I can live in a city anymore. I don’t know. What about you?

speaker: Lune
line: Well, Since we mere mortals can’t leave this Canvas, Maelle has kindly offered to Paint the outside world for me. So I can see.
